image.altText: Someone sitting in front of a bank of computer screens, their shirt says "Shuffle" on the back

props.synopsis: Online casino Shuffle's executives are gambling on its own live broadcasts, despite it being banned in Australia.

title.children: An online lottery banned in Australia is streamed live from Melbourne

image.altText: A graphic design of a plane, a NZ passport, a boarding pass and money.

props.synopsis: A former lawyer who received $1 million by mistake in a bank error transferred the money offshore, declared bankruptcy and left the country under a false name, a court has heard.

title.children: 'This is not true': Melbourne lawyer denies fleeing after $1.2m error

image.altText: Two police officers stand on a street outside a double storey brick home beside a white van at night.

props.synopsis: A man is charged with murder after a body was found at a house in Westmeadows, in Melbourne's north, yesterday.

title.children: Murder charge laid over Joshua Bishop's disappearance

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and in a gray jumper sitting a school photo shoot.

props.synopsis: A school principal accused of child sexual abuse was shuffled onto a series of new jobs, correspondence shows.

title.children: Documents show Victoria's education department ignored complaints about 'psychopathic rapist' principal

image.altText: An aerial shot of a burnt out house, with two brick chimneys still standing among trees and vehicles parked in the background.

props.synopsis: Police plead for information about the incident that left a 68-year-old man seriously injured and destroyed his home last week.Â

title.children: Burglars who bashed man, burnt down home may have got the wrong address

image.altText: Richmond's Tom Lynch clashes with two Adelaide Crows AFL players.

props.synopsis: Richmond's Tom Lynch shows remorse as he faces a suspension following an incident in Sunday's 68-point loss to the Adelaide Crows at the MCG.

title.children: 'I've got to be better': Tigers spearhead Lynch facing suspension

image.altText: A woman stand while holding a photo of herself and her husband in a photo frame.

props.synopsis: Heather Hughes' husband fought toxic fires for decades. But when he died of cancer WorkSafe rejected her dependency claim, despite recognising it as an occupational illness.

title.children: Mick died of cancer but his family's compensation claim was rejected

image.altText: Two large pine trees beside a red brick hotel in a small town main street.

props.synopsis: Anxious about the number of people posting CCTV images of attempted break-ins on social media, one beachside community has banded together to keep each other safe.

title.children: Neighbourhood Watch groups on the rise as residents try to combat crime

image.altText: man holding new suitcase

props.synopsis: The circular economy is flourishing as Australians upcycle and even sell the unsellable at op shops and second-hand dealers.

title.children: Learning to repurpose, resell and recycle is a win for purses and planet

image.altText: A mock up of a train on the Suburban Rail Loop

props.synopsis: Suburban Rail Loop Authority transport planners have calculated how much faster people will be able to between various destinations along the SRL East between Box Hill and Cheltenham, which is scheduled to open in 2035.

title.children: Suburban Rail Loop may shave up to 40 minutes from travel times in Melbourne's east

image.altText: Luke Jackson celebrates a goal by pointing right finger

props.synopsis: Luke Jackson kicks two final quarter goals to lead Fremantle to a comeback win over St Kilda at Perth Stadium, capping off a tough personal week in style.

title.children: Jackson inspires Freo with final quarter heroics after personal battle

image.altText: Images of blue and white checkered police tape stretched across a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A female quad-bike rider has died at the scene of a rollover in Victoria's south-west.

title.children: Woman dies after quad bike rolls

image.altText: A close up image of Tony Burke in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Immigration Minister Tony Burke says High Court-ordered revisions have made the preventative detention regime unworkable and he is instead focused on paying countries to take members of the NZYQ migrant cohort.

title.children: Burke concedes preventative detention laws for migrants have failed

image.altText: Penshurst Pub 2025-06-19 10:06:00

props.synopsis: The country town of Penshurst once had six pubs. Now, locals are scrambling to save their last remaining watering hole.

title.children: Victorian community rallies to buy town's last remaining pub

image.altText: A woman in a white jumper is holding a book open, smiling

props.synopsis: It's a story that became Aussie folklore, but for the descendants of those involved, the ripple effects of that frosty night 145 years ago would be felt for generations.

title.children: Fallout from Ned Kelly's last stand haunted families for generations

image.altText: Two men on a sofa smile at each as one bottle feeds a baby on his lap.

props.synopsis: With more Australians finding surrogate mothers overseas, parents and lawyers are calling for an overhaul of Australia's "patchwork" laws, while some ethicists say paying for babies should remain illegal.

title.children: Couples weigh commercial baby-making amid surrogacy laws review

image.altText: A rugby league player with a head guard on holds the ball as a player in blue tries to tackle him

props.synopsis: The Storm condemned the Sharks to a fourth defeat in five to drop out of the NRL's top eight before the Cowboys earned a desperately needed win against the Titans.Â

title.children: 'We can't hide from that': Sharks fall out of NRL top eight with Storm defeat

image.altText: Harley Reid stands up in a tackle and looks to handball as three Collingwood players try to stop him

props.synopsis: The Magpies lift when required against the bottom-placed Eagles, recording a 29-point win at Docklands, while the Hawks and Suns also celebrate victories.

title.children: Eagles coach to contact AFL over holding the ball calls in loss to Pies

image.altText: Four people in orange high vis tops, blue pants and hard hats walk along a raised concrete walkway inside a concrete tunnel.

props.synopsis: A state government frontbencher has retreated from initial denials that the Metro Rail Tunnel won't be fully operational until 2026.

title.children: Victorian Government concedes Metro Tunnel opening details still uncertain

image.altText: a weather graph over nsw of a forecast weather bomb

props.synopsis: Forget the headlines and hyperbole of the fictitious "rain bomb" â the real weather bomb is possible along Australia's east coast next week.

title.children: 'Bomb cyclone' ahead for Australia's east coast

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to a dozen families who say their sons have been subjected to, or groomed to inflict, violent punishments in an alleged decades-old cycle of torment at the Victorian boarding school.

title.children: Parents hire lawyers over alleged abuse at prestigious Ballarat Grammar

image.altText: Sydney player Joel Amartey has his arms outstreched in celebration and an open mouthed smile.

props.synopsis: Brandon Walker, Joel Amartey, Isaac Quaynor and Connor Idun all have a rich Ghanaian heritage that's shaping the way they play.

title.children: The Ghanaian-Australian quartet making a mark on the AFL

image.altText: Gail Jones landscape

props.synopsis: A queer thriller, new novels from some of Australia's biggest authors and luminous short stories are all on offer this month in our critics' top picks. They'll take you from South London to New Zealand to a post-apocalyptic future â and beyond.

title.children: The eight books our critics couldn't put down in June

image.altText: Man wearing a black shirt that says 'Burgertory' on the collar, with his arms folded.

props.synopsis: Melbourne businessman Hash Tayeh faces ATO legal action over $1m in unpaid taxes linked to 12 companies he directed while running fast food chain Burgertory.

title.children: Fast-food boss faces million-dollar tax battle

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: The social cost of gambling in Victoria, such as bankruptcy, loss of productivity at work, mental ill-health, and divorce, has reached $14 billion, a new study has found.

title.children: 'Horribly normalised addiction': Gambling harm in Victoria reaches $14b

image.altText: Two children playing the piano: a baby in the foreground staring at the keys and a toddler in the background smiling.

props.synopsis: Thanks to the generosity of everyday Australians and organisations around the country, communities have received pianos so they can share the gift of music.

title.children: Pop-up pianos are passing the gift of music all around Australia

image.altText: Victoria Police Chief Commissioner Mike Bush poses for a photo.

props.synopsis: Mike Bush has been sworn in as Victoria's new chief police commissioner, vowing to tackle rising crime rates and rebuild trust in the police force.

title.children: Victoria's new top cop swears to get tough on youth crime

image.altText: A group of Carlton and Brisbane players gather in a pack, with a Blues player in the air as rain tumbles down during a game.

props.synopsis: Unless you're playing at Docklands, weather is always a feature of games of AFL. Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson take a look at how teams adapt to different conditions, who plays better in the wet, and the growing issue of scheduling and heat.Â

title.children: How Australian Rules football adapts to the weather, and who's best in the wet

image.altText: aerial image of police car at scene of alleged assault in wheatsheaf

props.synopsis: A former Australian Army reservist who murdered his neighbour by throwing petrol on him and lighting him on fire will be in his 90s by the time he is eligible for parole.

title.children: 'Sad, angry' man jailed for 35 years after lighting neighbour on fire

image.altText: A traditional Indigenous headdress. It is of pyramid shape and has feathers at the top.

props.synopsis: A collection of 37 items gifted to former Mornington Island residents in the 1970s will be taken thousands of kilometres home after decades in the dark.

title.children: Artefacts kept in storage for decades to be returned to ancestral home

image.altText: A koala sitting among gum leaves.

props.synopsis: A group has launched court action after aerial culling was undertaken to end the suffering of about 1,0000 starving or burnt koalas affected by bushfire in Victoria.

title.children: Wildlife advocates file lawsuit over mass koala shootings

image.altText: A man with a black jacket and a walker stands next to a woman in a black jumper and a walker

props.synopsis: A not-for-profit organisation says increasing administrative costs linked to the federal government's aged care reforms have left it with no choice but to stop providing transport to social outings for residents.

title.children: Aged care reforms leave elderly cut off from social outings

image.altText: A man, smiling, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: A jury finds a man who stabbed a young Melbourne doctor 11 times after a home invasion guilty of murder.

title.children: Jury finds man guilty of murdering doctor Ashley Gordon

image.altText: Vegetable workers in horticulture farm

props.synopsis: Workplace law breaches are rampant in prime horticulture zones in Victoria and NSW, the ombudsman reports, with labour hire firms the worst culprits and migrant workers most affected.

title.children: Scathing report finds horticulture workers treated 'very badly'
